verses.kjv: So king Solomon was king over all Israel.
verses.ct: King Solomon ruled over all of Israel.

verses.kjv: And these were the princes which he had; Azariah the son of Zadok the priest,
verses.ct: These were his top officials: Azariah son of Zadok served as priest;

verses.kjv: Elihoreph and Ahiah, the sons of Shisha, scribes; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, the recorder.
verses.ct: Elihoreph and Ahiah, sons of Shisha, were secretaries; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was the official recorder.

verses.kjv: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the host: and Zadok and Abiathar were the priests:
verses.ct: Benaiah son of Jehoiada commanded the army; Zadok and Abiathar served as priests;

verses.kjv: And Azariah the son of Nathan was over the officers: and Zabud the son of Nathan was principal officer, and the king’s friend:
verses.ct: Azariah son of Nathan supervised the district governors; Zabud son of Nathan was a chief advisor and the king's personal friend;

verses.kjv: And Ahishar was over the household: and Adoniram the son of Abda was over the tribute.
verses.ct: Ahishar managed the palace; and Adoniram son of Abda was in charge of the forced labor.

verses.kjv: And Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel, which provided victuals for the king and his household: each man his month in a year made provision.
verses.ct: Solomon also appointed 12 district governors over all of Israel who were responsible for supplying food for the king and his royal court. Each one was responsible for providing supplies during one month of the year.

verses.kjv: And these are their names: The son of Hur, in mount Ephraim:
verses.ct: Here are their names: Ben-Hur, in the hill country of Ephraim;

verses.kjv: The son of Dekar, in Makaz, and in Shaalbim, and Bethshemesh, and Elonbethhanan:
verses.ct: Ben-Dekar, in Makaz, Shaalbim, Bethshemesh, and Elonbethhanan;

verses.kjv: The son of Hesed, in Aruboth; to him pertained Sochoh, and all the land of Hepher:
verses.ct: Ben-Hesed, in Aruboth, who also oversaw Sochoh and the entire territory of Hepher;

verses.kjv: The son of Abinadab, in all the region of Dor; which had Taphath the daughter of Solomon to wife:
verses.ct: Ben-Abinadab, over the whole district of Dor — he was married to Solomon's daughter Taphath;

verses.kjv: Baana the son of Ahilud; to him pertained Taanach and Megiddo, and all Bethshean, which is by Zartanah beneath Jezreel, from Bethshean to Abelmeholah, even unto the place that is beyond Jokneam:
verses.ct: Baana son of Ahilud, who oversaw Taanach, Megiddo, and all of Bethshean near Zartanah below Jezreel, stretching from Bethshean to Abelmeholah and beyond Jokneam;

verses.kjv: The son of Geber, in Ramothgilead; to him pertained the towns of Jair the son of Manasseh, which are in Gilead; to him also pertained the region of Argob, which is in Bashan, threescore great cities with walls and brasen bars:
verses.ct: Ben-Geber, in Ramothgilead, who oversaw the settlements of Jair son of Manasseh in Gilead, as well as the region of Argob in Bashan — 60 large walled cities with bronze gate bars;

verses.kjv: Ahinadab the son of Iddo had Mahanaim:
verses.ct: Ahinadab son of Iddo, in Mahanaim;

verses.kjv: Ahimaaz was in Naphtali; he also took Basmath the daughter of Solomon to wife:
verses.ct: Ahimaaz, in Naphtali — he had married Solomon's daughter Basmath;

verses.kjv: Baanah the son of Hushai was in Asher and in Aloth:
verses.ct: Baanah son of Hushai, in Asher and Aloth;

verses.kjv: Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah, in Issachar:
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat son of Paruah, in Issachar;

verses.kjv: Shimei the son of Elah, in Benjamin:
verses.ct: Shimei son of Elah, in Benjamin;

verses.kjv: Geber the son of Uri was in the country of Gilead, in the country of Sihon king of the Amorites, and of Og king of Bashan; and he was the only officer which was in the land.
verses.ct: Geber son of Uri, in the territory of Gilead — the former lands of King Sihon of the Amorites and King Og of Bashan. He was the sole governor for that region.

verses.kjv: Judah and Israel were many, as the sand which is by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking, and making merry.
verses.ct: The people of Judah and Israel were as numerous as sand on the seashore, and they ate, drank, and celebrated.

verses.kjv: And Solomon reigned over all kingdoms from the river unto the land of the Philistines, and unto the border of Egypt: they brought presents, and served Solomon all the days of his life.
verses.ct: Solomon ruled over all the kingdoms from the Euphrates River to the land of the Philistines and all the way to the border of Egypt. These nations paid tribute and served Solomon throughout his entire life.

verses.kjv: And Solomon’s provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour, and threescore measures of meal,
verses.ct: Solomon's daily food requirements were 30 measures of fine flour and 60 measures of grain,

verses.kjv: Ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and an hundred sheep, beside harts, and roebucks, and fallowdeer, and fatted fowl.
verses.ct: 10 fattened cattle, 20 pasture-fed cattle, 100 sheep, plus deer, gazelles, roebucks, and fattened poultry.

verses.kjv: For he had dominion over all the region on this side the river, from Tiphsah even to Azzah, over all the kings on this side the river: and he had peace on all sides round about him.
verses.ct: He controlled everything west of the Euphrates, from Tiphsah all the way to Azzah, ruling over every king on that side of the river. He enjoyed peace on every border.

verses.kjv: And Judah and Israel dwelt safely, every man under his vine and under his fig tree, from Dan even to Beersheba, all the days of Solomon.
verses.ct: Throughout Solomon's reign, everyone in Judah and Israel lived in safety, each person secure under their own vine and fig tree, from Dan all the way to Beersheba.

verses.kjv: And Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.
verses.ct: Solomon also had 40,000 stalls for his chariot horses and 12,000 horsemen.

verses.kjv: And those officers provided victual for king Solomon, and for all that came unto king Solomon’s table, every man in his month: they lacked nothing.
verses.ct: The district governors supplied food for King Solomon and everyone who ate at his table, each during their assigned month. They made sure nothing was lacking.

verses.kjv: Barley also and straw for the horses and dromedaries brought they unto the place where the officers were, every man according to his charge.
verses.ct: They also brought barley and straw for the horses and swift steeds to the designated locations, each governor fulfilling his assigned responsibility.

verses.kjv: And God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding exceeding much, and largeness of heart, even as the sand that is on the sea shore.
verses.ct: God gave Solomon extraordinary wisdom and insight, along with a breadth of understanding as vast as sand on the seashore.

verses.kjv: And Solomon’s wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east country, and all the wisdom of Egypt.
verses.ct: Solomon's wisdom surpassed that of all the wise men of the east and all the wisdom of Egypt.

verses.kjv: For he was wiser than all men; than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, and Chalcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol: and his fame was in all nations round about.
verses.ct: He was wiser than anyone — wiser than Ethan the Ezrahite, Heman, Chalcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol. His reputation spread to every surrounding nation.

verses.kjv: And he spake three thousand proverbs: and his songs were a thousand and five.
verses.ct: He composed 3,000 proverbs, and he wrote 1,005 songs.

verses.kjv: And he spake of trees, from the cedar tree that is in Lebanon even unto the hyssop that springeth out of the wall: he spake also of beasts, and of fowl, and of creeping things, and of fishes.
verses.ct: He spoke about plant life, from the great cedars of Lebanon down to the tiny hyssop growing out of walls. He also taught about animals, birds, reptiles, and fish.

verses.kjv: And there came of all people to hear the wisdom of Solomon, from all kings of the earth, which had heard of his wisdom.
verses.ct: People came from every nation to listen to Solomon's wisdom, sent by kings from all over the world who had heard about his extraordinary insight.
